modules.description: Provides functions to create bit-vector expressions, assert logical formulas, and check satisfiability. Works with bit-vectors, floating-point numbers, arrays, and uninterpreted functions. Used to verify constraints in formal verification or solve complex logical problems within OCaml applications.

The module offers low-level operations for managing SMT solver instances, configuring options, and constructing/inspecting sort types like bit-vectors, arrays, and floating-point values, along with term manipulation and property checks. It supports tasks such as formula assertion, satisfiability checking, model extraction, and handling complex data structures, including array indexing, function definitions, and IEEE 754 floating-point representations. Specific use cases involve verifying bit-vector arithmetic, analyzing floating-point constraints, and managing logical expressions in formal verification workflows.
